messages.message:
i don't think @demetr.starshov's question here (https://instabase.slack.com/archives/C05BJCNKZAM/p1749256132956159?thread_ts=1747858271.746079&cid=C05BJCNKZAM) has been answered yet?

@Kaustubh (KD) @jack.robbins do you have opinions on this?

I mean - I'd agree we don't want to send secret values directly. I frankly don't have a huge amount of experience in the security space but do know that sending those keys directly is typically cause for concern. Who do we typically ask security-related questions like this to?
@jack.robbins my understanding was sending secret aliases since that's what the user specifies for each app run / deployment config. They don't specify the value specifically

Let me provide additional context.
I can either return both custom values and secret aliases (not the values!) or custom values only. API-wise I would prefer to return only custom values so we explicitly distinguish what is where, but if aliases would provide any value for users we can send them as well
ah, okay. Shreya mentioned that they only need custom keys for now so I'd say we go with just those to be safe.
